definition: variant of 耽擱|耽搁[dan1 ge5]
to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
to bear/to stand/to endure
to place/to put aside/to shelve

sentences.english: He is an hour late -- He can have been delayed by fog.
sentences.chinese: 他迟到了一小时，可能由于大雾而担搁了。

sentences.english: Get busy doing all those things at home that you have been putting off for so long.
sentences.chinese: 担搁了很长时间的事情赶紧在这周完成吧。

sentences.english: I owe you to apology for the delay.
sentences.chinese: 我为这次担搁向你道歉。

sentences.english: If so, does it waste your time?
sentences.chinese: 那样又会不会担搁你的时间？

sentences.english: A few minutes' delay may not be a serious matter, but it may have bad results.
sentences.chinese: 担搁几分钟也许是一件小事，但它可能引起不良后果。

sentences.english: Our flight was delayed, owing to the bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 因为坏气候，咱们的班机给担搁了。

definition: to tarry/to delay/to stop over
variant of 耽誤|耽误[dan1 wu5]
not enough time (to do sth)/too late (to do sth)
to set out/to leave
to wait for a long time
to need the toilet/urinary or defecatory urgency
undue trouble/Thank you for having gone out of your way to help me.
to worry/to be on one's mind
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
worried/anxious
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
to make a journey for nothing
to go on a journey/to leave
to return/to go back/to come back
to adjourn/to defer
